alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 22 at 3:49AM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches possible, with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Northern St. Lawrence, Southeastern St. Lawrence and Southwestern St. Lawrence Counties. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult including Route 11. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized blizzard-like conditions are possible due to blowing snow resulting in very low visibilities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
